project.name: gf
project.description: A fun and easy WebGL-enabled JavaScript Game Engine

gf.AudioManager.name: gf.AudioManager
gf.AudioManager.description: Grapefruit Audio API, provides an easy interface to use HTML5 Audio The GF Audio API was based on Howler.js

gf.AudoPlayer.name: gf.AudoPlayer
gf.AudoPlayer.description: Grapefruit Audio API, provides an easy interface to use HTML5 Audio The GF Audio API was based on Howler.js

params.name: manager
params.description: AudioManager instance for this audio player

params.name: settings
params.description: All the settings for this player instance

params.name: animations
params.description:
An object of the form `{ animationName: [frame1, frame2] }` or you can also specify overrides on a per-animation basis:
     `{ animationName: { frames: [frame1, frame2], speed: 2 } }`. Each frame is a Texture object

params.name: speed
params.description: The speed of the animations (can be overriden on a specific animations)

params.name: start
params.description: The animation to start with, defaults to the first found key otherwise

gf.Camera.name: gf.Camera
gf.Camera.description:
A basic Camera object that provides some effects. It also will contain the HUD and GUI
to ensure they are using "screen-coords".

TODO: Currently fade/flash don't show the colors. How should I actually show them, a gf.Sprite?

params.name: game
params.description: The game this camera belongs to

params.name: settings
params.description: Any settings you want to override the default properties with

gf.DisplayObjectContainer.name: gf.DisplayObjectContainer
gf.DisplayObjectContainer.description: The base display object, that anything being put on the screen inherits from

gf.Sprite.name: gf.Sprite
gf.Sprite.description: The base Sprite class. This class is the base for all images on the screen

params.name: texture
params.description: The texture to set the sprite to

gf.TextureFont.name: gf.TextureFont
gf.TextureFont.description:
A texture font makes it easy to use a texture for writing generic text. Basically
this holds an array of textures each one representing a character, that all share
the same base texture (image). It is the same way a spritesheet works except you
use the textures for text instead of animation frames.

For special characters, you can either use the `.map` property to map a character
to a texture name like `font.map['~'] = 'tilde'` so that any `~` uses the texture named
`tilde + font.ext` for rendering; or you can make the texture name be the character code
prefixed with `#`. So, for `~`, naming the texture `#126.png` with `font.ext = 'png'`
would just work automagically. There is a default map already that you can view in the source,
and if you follow that naming convention, it will work without modification as well.

params.name: texture
params.description: The sprite sheet to use, if you pass a string make sure to preload it first

params.name: settings
params.description: All the settings for the font

props.name: ext
props.description: The extension used for the different texture names

props.name: map
props.description: Maps a special character to a string name

props.name: spaceSize
props.description: The size of a space character in pixels

props.name: lineWidth
props.description: The width factor of characters, default is 1 which is normal spacing

props.name: lineHeight
props.description: The height factor of characters, default is 1 which is normal spacing

props.name: text
props.description: Starting text of the font

gf.Game.name: gf.Game
gf.Game.description: Main game object, controls the entire instance of the game

params.name: contId
params.description: The container for the new canvas we will create for the game

params.name: settings
params.description: All the settings for the game instance

props.name: width
props.description: The width of the viewport

props.name: height
props.description: The height of the viewport

props.name: view
props.description: The canvas to render into

props.name: transparent
props.description: Whether the viewport should be transparent or not

props.name: renderMethod
props.description: Can be 'canvas' or 'webgl' to force that render method

props.name: background
props.description: The background color of the stage

props.name: interactive
props.description: Whether the game will use mouse events or not

gf.GameState.description: GameStates are different , controls the entire instance of the game

params.name: name
params.description: The name of this state

params.name: settings
params.description: All the settings for this game state

props.name: gravity
props.description: The gravity constant for the physics system (default is 9.87, which is normal Earth gravity)

gf.Gui.name: gf.Gui

gf.AssetLoader.name: gf.AssetLoader
gf.AssetLoader.description: The AssetLoader loads and parses different game assets, such as sounds, textures, TMX World JSON file (exported from the Tiled Editor), and Spritesheet JSON files (published from Texture Packer).

params.name: assets
params.description: Array of assets to load when `.load()` is called

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the resource to load, used as a key in the assetCache

params.name: urls
params.description: All the urls for the different formats of this audio file

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the resource to load, used as a key in the assetCache

params.name: url
params.description: The url to load the resource from, also used as a key in the assetCache

gf.Loader.description: The Base loader class that all other loaders inherit from

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the resource to load, used as a key in the assetCache

params.name: url
params.description: The url to load the resource from, also used as a key in the assetCache

gf.TiledLayer.name: gf.TiledLayer
gf.TiledLayer.description:
The TiledLayer is the visual tiled layer that actually displays on the screen

This class will be created by the TiledMap, there shouldn't be a reason to
create an instance on your own.

params.name: layer
params.description: All the settings for the layer

gf.TiledMap.name: gf.TiledMap
gf.TiledMap.description:
Tiled map, expects a Tiled TMX file loaded by the gf.loader as the argument.
The loader knows to load all textures and other resources when loading a world TMX
file, and this expets that to already be done.

params.name: game
params.description: The game the map is in

params.name: position
params.description: The starting position of the map

params.name: map
params.description: All the settings for the map

gf.TiledObjectGroup.name: gf.TiledObjectGroup
gf.TiledObjectGroup.description:
Tiled object group is a special layer that contains entities
TODO: This is all trash

params.name: group
params.description: All the settings for the layer

gf.TiledTileset.description:
This object represents a tileset used by a TiledMap.
There can be multiple Tilesets in a map

params.name: settings
params.description: All the settings for the tileset

gf.ImageLayer.description: ImageLayer is a layer represented by a single image

params.name: game
params.description: The game the layer is in

params.name: position
params.description: The starting position of the layer

params.name: layer
params.description: All the settings for the layer, or the texture to use

gf.Layer.description: Base Layer implementation, provides common functions for all Layer types

params.name: layer
params.description: All the settings for the layer

gf.Map.name: gf.Map
gf.Map.description: Base Map implementation, provides common functions for all Map types

params.name: map
params.description: All the settings for the map

gf.Tile.name: gf.Tile
gf.Tile.description: Base Tile implementation, a tile is a single tile in a tilemap layer

params.name: tile
params.description: All the settings for the tile

gf.ObjectPool.name: gf.ObjectPool
gf.ObjectPool.description:
Holds a pool of different Objects to help reduce the number times
an object is created and destroyed.

params.name: type
params.description: The object type that this pool will hold (like gf.Sprite, or gf.Tile)

params.name: parent
params.description:
The parent that the objects will be added to. Passing this in will
     make the pool add any newly created objects as children to this object.

gf.SpritePool.name: gf.SpritePool
gf.SpritePool.description:
Holds a pool of different Sprites that can be created, makes it very
easy to quickly create different registered entities

gf.Clock.name: gf.Clock
gf.Clock.description: High performance clock, from mrdoob's Three.js: /src/core/Clock.js

params.name: autoStart
params.description: Automatically start the counter or not

gf.EventEmitter.name: gf.EventEmitter
gf.EventEmitter.description:
Event emitter mixin. This will add emitter properties to an object
so that it can emit events, and have others listen for them.

gf.Vector.name: gf.Vector
gf.Vector.description:
A 2d Vector implementation stolen directly from mrdoob's THREE.js
thanks mrdoob: https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/blob/master/src/math/Vector2.js

params.name: x
params.description: The x component of the vector

params.name: y
params.description: The y component of the vector

gf.math.name: gf.math
gf.math.description: The grapefruit math library, used to abstract commonly used math operations

gf.utils.name: gf.utils
gf.utils.description: The grapefruit utility object, used for misc functions used throughout the code base

gf.support.name: gf.support
gf.support.description: Feature detection so we cans witch between renderers, play audio correctly, and other things.

gf.plugin.name: gf.plugin
gf.plugin.description:
Namespace for all plugins, it also provides methods for patching
core functions, and registering plugins.

classitems.description:
Set the 3D position of the audio source.
The most common usage is to set the 'x' position
to affect the left/right ear panning. Setting any value higher than
1.0 will begin to decrease the volume of the sound as it moves further away.
NOTE: This only works with Web Audio API, HTML5 Audio playback
will not be affected.
classitems.name: setPosition

params.name: x
params.description: The x-position of the playback from -1000.0 to 1000.0

params.name: y
params.description: The y-position of the playback from -1000.0 to 1000.0

params.name: z
params.description: The z-position of the playback from -1000.0 to 1000.0

params.name: id
params.description: The play instance ID.

When following a sprite this is the space within the camera that it can move around
before the camera moves to track it.

params.name: intensity
params.description: How hard to shake around

params.name: duration
params.description: The time in milliseconds to shake for

params.name: direction
params.description: The axes to shake the camera in default is gf.Camera.SHAKE.BOTH

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to call when the shaking has stopped

classitems.description: Stops a running shake effect
classitems.name: stopShake

classitems.description: Stops all currently running effects (flash, fade, shake)
classitems.name: stopAll

classitems.description:
Follows an sprite with the camera, ensuring they are always center view. You can
pass a follow style to change the area an sprite can move around in before we start
to move with them.
classitems.name: follow

params.name: sprite
params.description: The sprite to follow

params.name: style
params.description: The style of following, defaults to gf.Camera.FOLLOW.LOCKON

classitems.description: Stops following any sprites
classitems.name: unfollow

classitems.description: Focuses the camera on a sprite.
classitems.name: focusSprite

params.name: sprite
params.description: The sprite to focus on

classitems.description:
Focuses the camera on an x,y position. Ensures that the camera does
not go outside the bounds set with setBounds()
classitems.name: focus

params.name: x
params.description: The x coord to focus on, if a Point is passed the y param is ignored

params.name: y
params.description: The y coord to focus on

classitems.description:
Pans the camera around by the x,y amount. Ensures that the camera does
not go outside the bounds set with setBounds()
classitems.name: pan

params.name: x
params.description: The x amount to pan, if a Point is passed the y param is ignored

params.name: y
params.description: The y ammount to pan

classitems.description:
Resizes the viewing area, this is called internally by your game instance
when you call mygame.resize(). DO NOT CALL THIS DIRECTLY

params.name: h

Sets the bounds the camera is allowed to go. Usually this is the world's
min and max, and is set for you.

params.name: y
params.description: The minimum y coord (usually 0)

params.name: width
params.description: The maximum x coord (usually map width)

params.name: height
params.description: The maximum y coord (usually map height)

classitems.description: Called internally every frame. Updates all effects and the follow

classitems.description:
This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.
Setting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager
will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)

classitems.description: Wether or not the object will handle mouse events
classitems.name: interactive

Adds a child to the object.

X coord to put the object at.
      If an Array, Vector, or Point is passed then the y parameter is ignored

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the users clicks on the displayObject with their mouse
classitems.name: click

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the user clicks the mouse down over the displayObject
classitems.name: mousedown

classitems.description:
A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse that was over the displayObject
for this callback to be fired the mouse must have been pressed down over the displayObject
classitems.name: mouseup

classitems.description:
A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse that was over the displayObject but is no longer over the displayObject
for this callback to be fired, The touch must have started over the displayObject
classitems.name: mouseupoutside

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the users mouse rolls over the displayObject
classitems.name: mouseover

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the users mouse leaves the displayObject
classitems.name: mouseout

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the user moves the mouse while over the displayObject
classitems.name: mousemove

classitems.description:
A callback that is used when the users taps on the displayObject with their finger
basically a touch version of click
classitems.name: tap

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the user touch's over the displayObject
classitems.name: touchstart

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the user releases a touch over the displayObject
classitems.name: touchend

classitems.description:
A callback that is used when the user releases the touch that was over the displayObject
for this callback to be fired, The touch must have started over the displayObject
classitems.name: touchendoutside

classitems.description:
On Collision Event
     called when this sprite collides into another, or is being collided into by another.
     By default if something collides with a collectable sprite we destroy the collectable
     and if we collide with a solid tile we kill our velocity. This method will emit a
     'collision' event that you can listen for
classitems.name: onCollision

params.name: obj
params.description: Colliding sprite

classitems.description: Sprite types
classitems.name: TYPE

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the users clicks on the sprite with their mouse
classitems.name: click

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the user clicks the mouse down over the sprite
classitems.name: mousedown

classitems.description:
A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse that was over the sprite
for this callback to be fired the mouse must have been pressed down over the sprite
classitems.name: mouseup

classitems.description:
A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse that was over the sprite but is no longer over the sprite
for this callback to be fired, The touch must have started over the sprite
classitems.name: mouseupoutside

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the users mouse rolls over the sprite
classitems.name: mouseover

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the users mouse leaves the sprite
classitems.name: mouseout

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the user moves the mouse while over the sprite
classitems.name: mousemove

classitems.description:
A callback that is used when the users taps on the sprite with their finger
basically a touch version of click
classitems.name: tap

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the user touch's over the sprite
classitems.name: touchstart

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the user releases a touch over the sprite
classitems.name: touchend

classitems.description:
A callback that is used when the user releases the touch that was over the sprite
for this callback to be fired, The touch must have started over the sprite
classitems.name: touchendoutside

params.description: The maximum value a component can be

classitems.name: truncate

params.description: The number to truncate

classitems.description:
Snaps a number to a grid value.
For example, if you have a grid with gaps the size of 10 horizontally, and
a position of 11, it would snap to 10; a position of 18 would snap to 20
classitems.name: snap

params.name: num
params.description: The number to snap

params.name: gap
params.description: The gap size of the grid (the tile size)

params.name: offset
params.description: The starting offset of a grid slice (aka tile)

classitems.description:
Snaps a number to a grid value, using floor.
For example, if you have a grid with gaps the size of 10 horizontally, and
a position of 11, it would snap to 10; a position of 18 would also snap to 10
classitems.name: snapFloor

params.name: num
params.description: The number to snap

params.name: gap
params.description: The gap size of the grid (the tile size)

params.name: offset
params.description: The starting offset of a grid slice (aka tile)

classitems.description:
Snaps a number to a grid value, using ceiling.
For example, if you have a grid with gaps the size of 10 horizontally, and
a position of 11, it would snap to 20; a position of 18 would also snap to 20
classitems.name: snapCeil

params.name: num
params.description: The number to snap

params.name: gap
params.description: The gap size of the grid (the tile size)

params.name: offset
params.description: The starting offset of a grid slice (aka tile)

classitems.description: Convert radians to degrees
classitems.name: radiansToDegrees

params.name: angle
params.description: The angle in radians to convert

classitems.description: Convert radians to degrees
classitems.name: degreesToRadians

params.name: angle
params.description: The angle in degrees to convert

classitems.description: Calculates the angle between two points
classitems.name: angleBetween

params.name: pos1
params.description: The first position

params.name: pos2
params.description: The second position

classitems.description:
Returns a random boolean based on the provided chance. The chance represents the
percentage chance of returning: true.
classitems.name: randomBool

params.name: chance
params.description: The % chance of getting true (0 - 100), defaults to 50%

classitems.description: Returns a random int between min and max.
classitems.name: randomInt

params.name: min
params.description: The minimun number that the result can be

params.name: max
params.description: The maximun number that the result can be

classitems.description:
Returns a random sign based on the provided chance. The chance represents the
percentage chance of returning 1 (positive).
classitems.name: randomSign

params.name: chance
params.description: The % chance of getting true (0 - 100), defaults to 50%

classitems.description: Returns a random element of an array.
classitems.name: randomElement

params.name: array
params.description: The array to choose from

params.name: start
params.description: The index of the first element to include, defaults to 0

params.name: length
params.description: The number of elements from the start to include, defaults to the length of the array (minus the start index)

classitems.description: Ensures that some input is a vector, converts strings and arrays into vector objects
classitems.name: ensureVector

params.name: vec
params.description: The object to ensure becomes a vector

return.description:
The vector created with the passed values, if the values can't be made
     into a Vector, then a new Vector with 0,0 is returned

classitems.description: An empty function that performs no action
classitems.name: noop

classitems.description: Performs an ajax request, and manages the callbacks passed in
classitems.name: ajax

params.name: settings
params.description: The settings of the ajax request, similar to jQuery's ajax function

classitems.description: Wraps XMLHttpRequest in a cross-browser way.
classitems.name: AjaxRequest

classitems.description:
This will take values and override the passed obj's properties with those values.
The difference from a normal object extend is that this will try to massage the passed
value into the same type as the object's property. Also if the key for the value is not
in the original object, it is not copied.
classitems.name: setValues

params.name: obj
params.description: The object to extend the values into

params.name: values
params.description: The values to put into the object

      - Chrome 8+
      - Safari 6+
      - Opera 12+

  - Object.create
      - IE 9+
      - FF 4+
      - Chrome 7+
      - Safari 5+
      - Opera 12+

classitems.description: Inherits the prototype of a parent object.
classitems.name: inherits

params.name: child
params.description: The Child to inherit the prototype

params.name: parent
params.description: The Parent to inherit from

params.name: proto
params.description: The prototype to apply to the child

classitems.description:
Patches a core function with a new one. The function you override with has a special property
called `this._super` which is a reference to the function you are overriding.
classitems.name: patch

params.name: obj
params.description: The object with the method to override

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the method to override

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to override with

classitems.description: Registers a plugin into the gf namespace.
classitems.name: register

params.name: plugin
params.description: The object to place in the namespace

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the plugin to use as the key
